website_summaries.verdict: Gives moms-to-be relief from back, pelvic, and abdominal pain, especially those who spend a lot of time standing.
pros: Helps alleviate lower back, hip, and leg pain
Choice of beige, black, or white
Breathable fabric constructed of a multi-layered laminate with elastic lining
Easy to adjust from sitting to standing
cons: Must either undo the belt or pull the whole band up to use the bathroom
Hook-and-loop fabric is strong enough to damage delicate clothing

customer_reviews.title: Soft, strong and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered wrong size the first time. When I received the correct size I love it! Soft, strong and comfortable. I posted a size chart from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: autobodybabe

customer_reviews.title: EDITED! It’s a good product!
customer_reviews.text: It really helped with my back pain but it didn’t last very long before it started coming apart. I haven’t had it over a month and one of the support rods already came out. *************UPDATE********* Shortly after my review the seller contacted me and offered to replace my broken brace for NO CHARGE! After it arrived I found that I had received a fluke product the first time round. The straps and set up of the products did not look the same. The new one felt more sturdy and is working perfectly! 😁 Definitely would recommend this product for expecting moms! I Will post pictures soon!
customer_reviews.author: Nocturna bird

customer_reviews.title: Order this thing now!
customer_reviews.text: My regret is not ordering this sooner. And not having it on now. I was in a rush and completely forgot it. I am tempted to be late and turn around to get it. It has made such a difference in the back pain I had. I seriously love it and can not recommend it enough. My boyfriend laughs at me when I'm wearing it, because it does look kind of silly but trust me it's worth it, and you can't see it at all under your clothes. You can't beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: MagenMoreno

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Support
customer_reviews.text: Immediate support. Purchased a size Large, I’m 5’5 165lbs 8 months pregnant and there is still room in case my belly grows more. I wear Maternity U.S. size M/L tops and size 8-10 in pants to give you an idea. I gave it 4 stars because The instructions were confusing considering they were in Chinese. Luckily I found a YouTube video. Also, the Velcro is really hard core. If you accidentally let it touch your clothes it will ruin it if not rip it. I would only recommend wearing this over clothes. Not intended to underneath since it can get pretty itchy. Also, not comfortable if you will be sitting.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mtz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'5" 145-150lbs 7 months pregnant and got a medium Update: after wearing this my whole pregnancy I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LeeTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: No good..
customer_reviews.text: I personally was not impressed with this band. The first issue is that the part that goes on your belly in the photo looks to be 6-8" wide, however the one you get is only like 3-4". It digs into your stomach and it like a fly trap to get off when you are in a rush to go to the bathroom (late pregnancy every 2 minute pee breaks do not work with this). It looks better in the photo than it does in person as it is just too small. I purchased two thinking the first was defective and not cut correctly, but they were both the same. Returned both, would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse G.

customer_reviews.title: Plus size friendly and amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got and XXL and I measured 52", this is true to size if you follow the measurements. Wow! This is the second one I've bought, I've had the other for a little over a month and its amazing. I got it due to a pulling feeling that would trigger round ligament pains and just hurt. I had a pretty big belly before pregnancy and the fat on top of my uterus was really weighing my whole abdomen down but this belt helps so much. I wear it over a light tank top under my shirts and dresses. If you are plus size like I am dont be afraid to purchase this, I was hesitant but so glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Flipster

customer_reviews.title: Great maternity belt! Super supportive
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this belt! It is so supportive! I’m 31 weeks and still working out, I needed something to help with pelvic pressure during Zumba and to wear at work when I’m on my feet all day. This is perfect! I got a large and it fits great with room to grow (I’m 5’7”, 195 lbs, 31 weeks and mostly belly, was 175 pre-prego but normally I’m 155, had not lost my baby weight from my first pregnancy yet)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H

customer_reviews.title: Love this belt! Used it with 2 pregnancies! Less back pain and NO belly stretch marks!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin - this is my 3rd time purchasing the belt. The first was for myself (I used it with 2 different pregnancies) and the 3rd was a gift. It's amazing and I will tell you why: 1. If you are experiencing back pain, this will help relieve that constant ache by helping support that belly weight in front. 2. Want to avoid stretch marks - use this. I wore this under my clothing and while exercising like the last trimester and I didnt have a single stretch mark. Having support keeps your skin from stretching. This
customer_reviews.author: Dazzlme603

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the upper band. Comes in multiple pieces.
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't the easiest to try on and maybe it's just preference but I did not care for the upper band that goes over top of your belly. It just felt like unneeded extra pressure instead of support. And there are a couple of pieces to this to put it together. There are actual instructions, which were helpful but just seems too complicated in my opinion if you need a list of instructions. I prefer the simple one piece type that goes around the bottom of the belly. This would also be very obvious under any clothing. It seems like it would support you but I just couldn't wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Better on top of clothes and weight relief/support
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like how it feels against my bare skin. It tends to irritate me, and I end up wearing it over my clothes. However, my bump is rather large to the point people think I’m carrying twins, and it offers some relief from the weight and makes my back feel a little better when I’m on my feet and active. It becomes too tight for me when I sit down, and I have to readjust it which is another reason why I wear it on top of my clothes. Additionally, I’m about 155 pounds, my last baby was 10.2 pounds and this baby is big, and I bought a size medium which still fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently 29 weeks pregnant with a ginormous baby that is measuring significantly ahead of her gestational age. This is also my fifth child so my uterus is beyond done at this point. I work as a floor nurse and I kept having hard, constant contractions and pressure. I bought this because my obgyn recommended one to support my uterus. It works great to stop the constant contractions, it even supports the lower back. Sitting down with this on is very uncomfortable though. And after wearing it for more than 2 hours it caused sharp pain where my ovaries are. It is good for short periods that you'll be on your feet for sure...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS. I’m in my 3rd pregnancy and my stomach muscles are so loose I needed a binder to be able to do normal things again. This has enabled me to do things like I would’ve before pregnancy and helps support my belly so much. Obviously I can tell I’m wearing something but it’s SO comfortable I don’t even care. The material is so great you could wear directly on your skin under a shirt and be fine, I just have been wearing my full belly panel pants & using the belt to keep the panel up. Seriously buy this, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to start with the downfall of this product. It was rather difficult to figure out how to put this on. Even after following the directions it took a good minute to get used to all the different pieces BUT this did exactly what it’s supposed to once it was on correctly. It’s comfortable and you can wear it under your clothes without it being noticeable. It definitely gives good support and takes the weight of your belly.
customer_reviews.author: Monikanicolle

customer_reviews.title: Not plus size friendly, but works ok.
customer_reviews.text: This product does make my belly not feel so heavy however I wish the front band was wider for the plus sizes belts (I ordered the xxl). The back could of been slightly wider as well. I just don’t think it’s very plus size friendly, but it’s very affordable and does help a bit, I have to wear a second belly band over it as the front band barely supports enough, my belly fat tends to hang over it. If your not a plus sized person before pregnancy this would be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus cantieri

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it.
customer_reviews.text: Super uncomfortable. Pushes your stomach up into an uncomfortable position and makes your bump look weird. My baby hates it. It makes her uncomfortable and she kicks me until I take it off. I bought it to help with sciatic nerve pain and it makes it MUCH worse. Honestly, just save your money. I have nothing good to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: WRey

customer_reviews.title: A great product.  Works very well.  What a difference.
customer_reviews.text: Saved the day! Quality is ten stars. My lady was pretty damn miserable thanks to our most recent addition and once I got her to put it on she atarted feeling better. Her chiropractor, doctor her and I all see the improvement. It definitely helps make it more bearable for her. If your lady is having it rough in the back pain Dept help her out and grab a few of these - do not expect one size to last from second to third trimester to delivery. They are cheap enough to grow with your lady and baby.
customer_reviews.author: Optimal Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great support belt
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5 months pregnant with twins, suffering from painful S.P.D. This belt is definitely helping. I wear it from when I get up, till I go to bed. So much more affordable than the same thing from Motherhood Maternity.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3monkies

customer_reviews.title: XL girl in need of support!
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write reviews, but thought it might be helpful for other women my size to see feedback on this product. I am currently 31 weeks and about 250 lbs with a pre-pregnancy size of 18/20. I bought this product earlier on in my pregnancy and I am so glad I did now. I'm currently in a nesting mood and need more back support to get done what I need, and this support belt works wonderfully to easy up the tension on my back. It believe that I bought the size XL and know its going to fit through the rest of my pregnancy. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessamyn Karlovich

customer_reviews.title: Good support, but bulky look
customer_reviews.text: At 22 weeks I really popped and started feeling a lot of lower back pain as well as uncomfortable stomach stretching. I bought this to wear at work. I actually do enjoy the fit and feel, but my main issue with it is that it is bulky. You won't be able to wear it under clothes without it showing. I figure I will get the point where I don't care anymore, but it does limit me from wearing it as much. It is also fairly hot and I have to wear a tank top between it and my skin due to rubbing. Overall I would recommend it to anyone looking for back support.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I developed diastasis recti (separation of ab muscles) with my second child and this belly band was a life saver any time I was on my feet for an extended period of time (not meant for sitting). I threw it on when I went on walks and when I would spend time cleaning the house and then cooking dinner. It was GREAT! I saw some negative comments about discomfort but all you need is full panel maternity pants/shorts under the band and it's perfect. Your shirt goes right over it (so no one even knows you have it on) and it's a barrier from skin contact 👍👍👍 Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed with this product. I have bad HG and now SPD. My doctor recommended I get a supportive belly band to ease the pain and pressure. I wore this for a day and it actually made me feel worse. I don’t think it really holds my belly up in any way. I couldn’t find a way to return it. So now I’m out money for no reason. It’s so disappointing honestly. I was hoping for some relief. But this offered 0 support
customer_reviews.author: Coral Denakis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this at all. The first time I put it on it seemed to help. But I only wore it for a minute to see if it fit. I bought it to help with support while I’m working since I have a physically demanding job. It’s uncomfortable, it made my lower back pain worse, and it hardly supports your belly. This is my second kid and I was around 30 weeks pregnant when I purchased it. I don’t recommend getting this, it’s not worth the money and doesn’t really do what it promised.
customer_reviews.author: Ashli Berry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me, but seems well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping, based on another review, that it would help with some inner hip/groin pain I developed in late third trimester. It didn't. I can see how this would help lower back pain, but I know how to stand with correct posture and don't need it for that purpose right now. I found it be uncomfortable to wear against bare skin due to the velcro on the top elastic band that fits over your belly. Otherwise, very comfortable. Seems well made. I appreciate the easy, free returns!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good Support, Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This belt helped me get through my last few months of pregnancy and I wished I had purchased it sooner. I was carrying low & I was able to keep walking & moving around. A lot of back support and lift for the front / bottom of my belly. The main drawback of this belt is that it gets really hot when you're wearing it. I wore it every day for about two or three months. It stood up to washing, although the velcro started to lose some of it's power towards the end. So I wouldn't expect it to get me through my next pregnancy, but I would consider buying a brand new one the next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie A.

customer_reviews.title: Multiple pieces - But Great/comfy Support
customer_reviews.text: It's in 3 pieces, which I didn't realize, so it takes a minute or two to put on and get situated. But it really gives great support, and it's not uncomfortable. I had a general under-the-belly band and it's just not enough - this is much more supportive AND I can actually wear it while sitting down. I'm up and down a lot at work, so it's really important to be able to wear it sitting or standing/walking. I'm not really sure how good it is at relieving my pain, as my back is currently thrown out and pain is kind of a given regardless. But for now, this brace is pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: It sufficed for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: This was a big help for my wife throughout her pregnancy. She has a pubis dysfunction and said this belt helped lift the baby up, provided support and took pressure off her back and hips. The only thing is I ordered it at about 30 weeks and the Velcro basically wore out by 37 weeks so it would never fasten for long and would always come undone. Didn’t help her at the tail end of her pregnancy. She delivered at 39 weeks so we managed but it would’ve been nice to have all the way up until the baby came.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carney

customer_reviews.title: Great support... Might not fit larger women/baby bellies
customer_reviews.text: I got this product when I was around 4 months and, could notice immediate relief. Although it stopped fitting correctly around 6/7 months, the back support won't stay strapped around. I am not a petite woman, I'm curvy at 5'4" around 250lbs so I do understand I'm bigger...but I ordered this one because others said it fit their larger frame, so I'm not sure if my baby is just larger or if my body shape is different from others. But it defiantly works. Just not able to use it anymore which is sad as i need it more now then I did before.
customer_reviews.author: Shi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and was VERY impressed with the quality. I've seen similar designs for so much more. I was between sizes based off measurements, so I went towards a large just in case. I was able to wear it a few days, but was slightly uncomfortable because it was just a bit big. This wonderful company allowed me to switch sizes with no issues whatsoever. This has been one of my best experiences ever with any company, and the product is so comfortable and makes such a huge difference in my life. Would HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: batman

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference both during and after pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I used this both during pregnancy and after. During it helped support the extra weight and take pressure off my back - which if you have been in the last trimester you know you have quite a bit of weight to support... After the pregnancy, there is a lot of extra stuff that needs to go back to normal, and it was great to support my stomach while healing. Over all it was easy to put on, it is slightly bulky on the sides where the straps velcro together. And if you have love handles like I do, the back of the support can ride up. More annoying, but not uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife says this makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.text: I order this for my wife who at the time was 26 weeks pregnant. Her back had been hurting. We got it in and she put it on under her clothes and over her clothes both ways and she said it made a huge difference in her back and how she felt. It is noticeable under tight clothing but if you have a flowly shirt you can’t even tell. She also stated it is not uncomfortable to wear all day long both around the house and to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D

customer_reviews.title: poor velcro
customer_reviews.text: I love this maternity belt, it has helped me so much with sciatic pain. But I am super disappointed because the Velcro has already worn and it does not stick anymore. I have only worn it 2 times during a 12 hour shift as a nurse. I am really sad about the quality of this product because it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse/Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great belt, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a great maternity belt. I didn’t get it until 32 weeks and am wearing it at 38 weeks. I got an XL and should have got a L but it works okay just crosses over a bit more than I would like. I’m 210lb at 38 weeks and 5’5” carrying my second child. Only bad thing about it is that it’s a three piece belt (tummy band, back support, over bump band) and it takes a minute to get it all off to go to the bathroom (happens a lot at 38wks!)
customer_reviews.author: julie vincent carr

customer_reviews.title: Great and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter. It was suggested that she gets on since she now has another hernia. So I got this to help support her belly so that she does not get a third hernia. She said it supports her back very well. She said she has to readjust each time she sits down and gets up because it scrunches up and slides. But, she said when standing and walking it gives great support. The top strap itches her stomach. So I suggested that she puts it on over her tank top. Overall, great belly band for rhw price
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Velcro stops working after a few weeks - even with different sizing
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this item! It works for a few weeks and then the Velcro slips. I thought I ordered the wrong size with a small because after 10 days it kept detaching. I ended up getting a medium and now it is doing the same thing. My pre pregnancy size is 2 so it’s not a sizing issue, more like a product issue. I received the medium at the end of July and like the last item, a few weeks later when I take a deep breath the Velcro pops off. Not what you would expect for the price. Hoping this product gets me through my mid September due date but not likely.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey G.

customer_reviews.title: really amazed at this item - had really bad sciatica pain ...
customer_reviews.text: really amazed at this item - had really bad sciatica pain related to pregnancy and couldn't figure out why - I believe now it was my posture - this definitely helped a ton. it corrected my posture - a little uncomfortable at times since the baby has turned into birthing position but with a little adjusting, it works. I've worn under thin summer dresses and no one could tell - you can see the imprint of the lower belly band through fitted dressed though - not terrible though.
customer_reviews.author: Sunieta Dyer

customer_reviews.title: It work
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and very comfy to wear for whole day. It ease my pain and i seem to have less contraction after i use the belt. I was having early contraction Around my 22-23 weeks and my dr suggest that i should wear supporting belt hoping it help me with my problem. And it did in a way since i wear i have less contraction my hip and pelvic pain ease up a little bit and i feel like i can walk again.
customer_reviews.author: Ttea

customer_reviews.title: A pregnant nurse that says thanks!
customer_reviews.text: This maternity belt has saved my life I work 12 hour shifts in an ER. With this belt I have made it to 39 weeks still working. It helped my posture and took pressure off of my hip. I’m not going to say it took the pain away, but it made it a little easier. I like the band that goes across the top part of the stomach, but I also had really bad reflux and would have to take it off throughout the day. This is a pic of me at 35 weeks with the maternity band.
customer_reviews.author: Keia S

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought there’s no way. As my belly grew it became more and more useful. My issue is the back. It rides up and folds and bunches when you move. So unless you’re standing up straight and still like a statue it doesn’t stay put. I bought the biggest size and it was still too small. I could only wear it for about 30 minutes at a time. It’s very uncomfortable, BUT when you’re sitting or standing completely still, it does ease the pain for even just a little bit. That’s a lot for when you’re 7 months and just huge and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Aarons Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice an dit has helped a little bit but the thing I dont like about it is that it does get hot when you wear it when its warm out. I put it right against my skin because I feel it's easier then putting it over my clothes and having to take it off or readjust when I have to use the bathroom. The top strap can get annoying but I feel like if I do t wear the top strap then I dont get the full support I need.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Thankful for this product!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I wish I had bought this a lot sooner than 34 weeks. This is my 3rd pregnancy and never needed a brace until now. Getting the brace on, at first, was a bit confusing but I think that was just user error and pregnancy brain. After the second time getting the brace together, it’s easy peasy. Very comfortable, just have to find the right spot for the back support. I like the extra strap that goes on top of the belly! It really pulls the whole brace together.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Poche

customer_reviews.title: A little small on the back material but very effective support
customer_reviews.text: The material that goes on your back is a little small for the size that I ordered. I'm 230 pounds so I believe this material should have been larger as it only covers a portion of my back (in height) and is ackward because of where it sits, either my love handles or back fat falls over the material and looks horrible. It's a VERY comfortable support brace. I was having pretty severe lower back pain and this really helped. I took it off halfway through my day thinking that it wasn't really working and quickly realized that it really was helping!
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Helps with SPD pain
customer_reviews.text: My midwife recommended buying a support band for pelvic girdle pain. I'm 26 weeks pregnant with twins, and have found wearing the belt alleviates some of the pain. The belt has improved my mobility. I wear it to do household chores and for short walks. The design makes fitting the band easy, and it is comfortable to wear. I'm 5'5 and weigh 165 pounds, and the medium fit well with room to grow. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NJMom

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: All of the times that I've tried to wear this maternity belt I haven't been able to keep it on for more than 10 minutes because it is not comfortable at all. At first it feels supportive, but then it just gets to be too uncomfortable, specially when you move around and/or sit. Its too restrictive, I bought another kind of belt that is all one stretchy cloth piece and it is way better, even though you can't adjust it. I bought the right size, it's just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more round ligament pain!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great support for round ligament pain. Bought this at 32 weeks after outgrowing my other band, that just went under the stomach. This band has completely stopped my round ligament pain. I’m able to be on my feet a lot more and work for longer periods of time. You can really feel the difference with the support versus the kind that just go under the belly. When I need to go to the bathroom I just un do the straps on each side, then Velcro them back....no problem at all!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Evans

customer_reviews.title: Instant pain relief
customer_reviews.text: EVERY PREGNANT WOMAN SHOULD OWN ONE OF THESE!!! I'm 27 weeks, and my belly is huge and kills my entire back, including my neck. I've also been having numbness and tingling in my right hand due blood vessels in my lower back being cut off by the weight. This helps lift the baby off of the spine, and truly provides instant pain relief. I went by the sizing chart and it fits perfectly. Also, very well made and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. Black

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: This save my pelvis big time towards the end of my pregnancy. I’m disappointed I didn’t buy it sooner. I suffered from really bad SPD (pelvic girdle pain) to the point I couldn’t function during the day. I bought this giving it a chance and it was amazing. My pain decreased significantly. It is a sturdy belt but not difficult to put on. Worth the investment. Sizing was just right.
customer_reviews.author: addsnhere

customer_reviews.title: loved it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when i was at end of 1st trimester. I am obese and having an extra belly weight on my backbone was painful for me initially since my body was not used to with extra weight on it. I was skeptical about buying this belt since my belly was 45" already back then and I was worried that it will not fit me when I grow bigger in 2nd & 3rd trimester. therefore ended up ordering XXL size and it worked like magic throughout my pregnancy. I couldn't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Ritenkumar Patel

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: I work in the service industry any where from 4-12 hour "on my feet" shifts. This belt was a life saver the bigger I got. Started wearing it at 6 months, I wish I would have started earlier. Of course like any thing you wear for support it does get annoying after a 10 hour shift, but no different then a bra would be. I highly recommend using a belt. I didn't my first 2 pregnancies, and wish I would of now.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaP

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfy
customer_reviews.text: As a plus sized person my options are limited. I tried this one hoping it would work. It’s made a lot like the prescription ones, but it doesn’t provide as much support. It’s very uncomfortable. Doesn’t so much for support or pain.
customer_reviews.author: Marlissa

customer_reviews.title: Instant Relief
customer_reviews.text: Now I never EVER write reviews but this is needed. I am 5’4 and 304 lbs at 27 weeks pregnant. I got the XXL in fear it wouldn’t fit because let’s face it most things don’t fit me that are suppose to. I could have sized down!!!! This belt is so comfortable and supportive. It def was a learning curve but once I got it I instantly felt the relief. I recommend 1000 times over! If you are bigger or smaller and having second thoughts about purchasing this belt just do it! I promise you it will change your life!
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’2” and was 103 lbs before pregnancy and 125 lbs now at 27 weeks. Bought the small size and it fits like a glove with plenty of room to spare for my growing belly! It’s incredibly supportive, comfortable and fits really nicely under my clothes. Just remember that when you buy it your pain probably won’t go away completely, but it’ll be alleviated and any relief is better than none! It definitely makes life a lot easier and I wear it any time I leave the house now
customer_reviews.author: Allex Leon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m 29 yrs old and 24 weeks 5 days pregnant. Weight 151, gained 7 pounds just this month and been having a lot of back pains. Seen the reviews first of course seen a lot of good reviews so I gave it a try. And works wonders! Love how I can go all day with little to no pain all day! Does feel weird when I take it off but for the most part I love it! I don’t like that it folds in the back a little. So makes it a little uncomfortable but it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Zulu

customer_reviews.title: A must for multiples
customer_reviews.text: If you are pregnant with multiples or just carrying a bigger baby this is a must! Regular belly bands didn’t offer me the support I need with twins, especially towards the end of pregnancy. This band made me feel supported and made my back feel much better. Made it some what more bearable to get out of the house and walk around in the final weeks of pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: StacyJ2001

customer_reviews.title: Great support for pregnant ladies...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this belt for 3 days now. I am not sure about pain relief. I still have to use it for a few more days to find out how it helps to lower back pain. I am wearing it when I go for a walk, it is really supportive. I feel a little light after wearing it. I can say it is comfortable but I have seen marks on my belly after I remove it. Of course, it provides great support.
customer_reviews.author: Ruchi

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver, if you put it on properly as instructions show it is the best thing you can get when your pregnant as it does support your back with your baby stomach weight pulling on your muscles forward & atthe same time downward, it is very comfortable and I can can wear under anything dresses tight shirts pants and you can't even tell I'm wearing it, very comfy & very sturdy, the material is not cheap & will last you if you take proper care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 mo pregnant on my second baby. This belt gives me support and pain relief from round ligament pain. I wear it over a tank top. The material is thick , I get warm in it. It’s not that comfortable but does it’s job. The back part scrunches up and looks bulky. The front slides up at times. You have to undo the belt when going to bathroom. The quality I would say is a little poor. I wore it for a day and the Stitching was coming undone at the bottom of the belt. We will see how long this belt will last.
customer_reviews.author: Why

customer_reviews.title: Fits and helps
customer_reviews.text: I’m 33 weeks pregnant, 202 lbs and I bought the XL. Fits great, a little complicated to learn how to wear but I figured it out. I appreciate the support it provides for this heavy baby. I’m not currently working and I don’t wear it all day so I can’t comment on if it helps that much. I just wear it around the house when cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this belt! It helps !!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is awesome!! I’m 27 weeks pregnant and started getting lower pelvis pain during my walks and couldn’t hold my bladder but 5 minutes! Just walked 30 minutes outside with this belt and felt amazing. No pelvis pain or pressure . It holds the belly up for sure and helps support the back too! I weigh 145 at this time in the pregnancy and ordered a size medium definitely still have room to grow in it ! I think it was the perfect size! Very adjustable with the Velcro! Highly recommend for work if standing and to stay active around the house !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Grove

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t buy for pain but I did buy because my body and muscles were straining when i am on my feet due to my heavy pregnancy belly. This has been a lifesaver. It helps hold the weight of my tummy so that I can walk around and stand without being miserable. I do have to remove it when I sit down or else I find breathing difficult as my belly is scrunched up closer to my lungs. Also, I’ve found it more convenient to wear over my clothing when I’m at home.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cost effective helper
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good help to my wife, she feels much better after the belt. The other plus point is the reasonable cost as opposed to the ones at maternity stores where it's double the cost. My wife is short like 5ft and her tummy droops a bit, after using the belt it helps her reduce discomfort and back pain. She has a much better time during her walks and also during the day in office too
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Mathur

customer_reviews.title: This DOES give pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, boy, did my daughter have a difficult pregnancy! Her hips started separating around 23 weeks, putting huge pressure on her hips and back, and this belt helped her immensely! It was large and cumbersome, but the pain relief was worth it! It didn't completely make her pain-free, but you get to the point where you'll take whatever relief you can get! It was annoying to her how it would shift when sitting down, but there's really no way to avoid that. Overall, it helped her, so I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Katniss05Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SCIATICA!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these with my previous pregnancy and looked all around the local stores and couldn't find this one. I love the high back on it so it doesn't cut into you. It's adjustable as you grow. Helps tremendously with sciatica. I highly recommend this for anyone having back problems. True to size. I am about a size 7-8 not pregnant and ordered a large. It is still snug enough to support and I'm only 6 months pregnant so it has lots of growing room too.
customer_reviews.author: APoston2506

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive for the price. Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: 7 Months, 125lbs, 5'6, size small. This is pretty great. Holds up my belly well and easy to put on. I wear it for my 12hr shifts as a nurse. The back support is amazing as well. I'll leave it at 4 stars for now because I have to adjust multiple times at work, but that's nobody's fault. I've only had it 1week. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have put this product through its paces. I
customer_reviews.text: I have put this product through its paces. I have a very active job, so my midwife told me to just invest in this. I did, and have been wearing it daily for work (and outside of work if I've planned anything strenuous) for a month or so now. I wouldn't make it through my work day without out. It assists in keeping some strain off my ligaments, and my lower back hasn't started hurting, either. Beautiful, will probably buy another, and I absolutely recommend getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Chanjin

customer_reviews.title: but isn’t comfortable to wear unless you have a cami or shirt ...
customer_reviews.text: It helps for sure, but isn’t comfortable to wear unless you have a cami or shirt on under it. Skin to belt is not comfy. It also comes in 3 pieces, so if you’re not proficient with it, it takes some getting used to. That said it’s a lot of material to have to have while being pregnant in the summer. I had to buy a different belt due to the heat and it’s not the best to have to go to the bathroom quickly. Often I would have to readjust or take off to be comfortable to go to the restroom. Not ideal for a working mom to be.
customer_reviews.author: Lk

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it says it does! I am 31 weeks pregnant, and up 25 lbs, I started having pretty bad pelvic/sciatic pain after working out the last few weeks. Today, I used this maternity belt while doing my daily 30 minutes of walking uphill and no sciatic pain during/after! I am SO happy! This is life changing for me this last trimester!
customer_reviews.author: Beekayohh

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I have been having severe pelvic pain since 32 weeks of pregnancy. I can’t get any relief so upon recommendation from my doctor I got this to try and lift off some of the pressure. I only give this 4 stars because it unfortunately did not relieve my pain for me however I do feel this gives great support I think for back pain this would be good.As a hairdresser it has helped me throughout my day shampooing clients and being on the move a lot.The quality is good and for the price it’s pretty reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Great belt but causes itch
customer_reviews.text: My wife took 2 days to figure out the ‘correct’ position how to make this belt help her back ache. Once she did, she was so happy! It really relieved her pain a lot. She almost gave up and thought this might be just a waste of money. She can now sit for few hours straight without complaining. I knocked a star off because it causes itch when it has direct contact to the skin. She has sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Dayu

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait, just buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I went ahead and bought this product even though I'm only 18 weeks pregnant. It is already helping with my back pain and supporting my belly weight so I know I'm going to get my money's worth! I like that you dont have to use the top strap to support the belly since my belly isn't large enough yet to cause it to slide down yet. I have only worn this over a layer of clothes so not sure if velcro attachments would cause skin irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is great. I find the upper belly strap a little weird so I don’t wear that part but this really supports my back! It has helped my pregnancy back pain tremendously! I use this when I know I am going to be pretty active, even just doing housework. I find that it prevents my back from hurting so bad afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Feliciak09

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This belt is fairly comfortable and definitely serves its purpose. It reduced pulling and stretching pains in my abdomen and, what I believe, helped to reduce number of stretch marks. I would give it 5 stars but... 1. The front support band is narrower then on a picture and doesn’t offer that nice even support up to your bellybutton. 2. It’s fairly stiff and crinkles uncomfortably. If I need to sit down or bend it slides up and I have to pull it back in place almost every 10 min. 3. It’s almost impossible to hide under summer clothes, you can see the stiff edges and you can definitely tell it is there unless you really layer your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie I

customer_reviews.title: Quite adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and had to guess about the size. The medium worked well for a 5’5, fit woman in her 5th month. She says it is so adjustable that she should be able to wear it for a long time. There is lots of Velcro for both the top and bottom pieces, so it can be easily customized. She had been complaining about some back discomfort and difficulty managing the weight of her belly during exercise, and this turned out to be a terrific solution for both issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the beige maternity belt because it came next day. It has helped with some with the uncomfortableness of this pregnancy. I purchased it at 32 weeks, was worried because I don't have much longer to go, but I'm glad I did. We've been packing things up to make room for new baby and this has helped support my belly while moving around a lot. I have only worn it inside, so I put in on overtop my shirts, it's not flattering, but it does help. It comes in 3 pieces, it look a bit to figure it out, but once you put it on a couple times it's easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: My back and belly feel very supported
customer_reviews.text: I really love the support this belt gives me. Very comfortable and light weight. My back feels well supported when I wear this belt, so far so good. I ordered a size large. I am 5' 9" and 190 lbs (160 lbs pre-pregnancy weight). Currently 6 months pregnant and I measure 42 inches around my belly. With the size large my belly definitely has room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice89

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: This band works great to support my belly. I’m a massage therapist so I’m on my feet all day and leaning forward. This band has limited all my pain I was having. It is totally worth the money! The only thing I would say is the Velcro can be scratchy if not placed perfectly on the band.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great support, but very itchy!
customer_reviews.text: This provides great support and has really helped to alleviate my back and round ligament pain. My only complaints are that it didn't come with instructions on placement, the velcro often sticks to mesh portions of the belt (snagging and fraying more delicate areas), and it's VERY ITCHY in areas on the back portion - this is especially troublesome because I need to wear at least two layers under it (a single shirt still allows the itchy/pokey fibers to stick through). Wearing dual layers under it and then another on top (clothes so that I can go out in public) makes it very uncomfortable and hot, so I really only use this while I'm at home.
customer_reviews.author: MJJ

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you’re on your feet all day
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for lower belly support because I’ve gotten bigger faster with baby #2 and was getting pains in the upper part of my abdomen because of it. I’m a physician and on my feet all day. The pains were nearly unbearable 1/2 way through the day. This belt gives me the support I need to last all day. An unexpected plus was that I had started to get SI joint pain near the end of the day. I don’t notice this at all on the days I wear the belt. It’s been a huge relief.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I’ve been already recamended it to a couple people that have also placed orders to get theirs. I’ve tried a few different belly bands theewout my pregnancy and none have been able to do all the things this one does. I have a torn muscle in my back, work 10 plus hours in the ER and just haven’t been able to get relief in my back or my ever growing belly, till this band. It supports my back and belly and is breathable so I’m not hot. It comes in 3 parts so everything is adjustable with Velcro. Love this product
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I am 25 weeks pregnant and had back pain and discomfort. I had one of these maternity belts with a prior pregnancy. I don’t think I would have made it through without one. This belt helps with back pain and helps support the belly. I work in an office sitting all day and this helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: caro30

customer_reviews.title: Back support feels flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The belt seems ok but I can already tell it's not enough support for my awful back, it feels flimsy at the top and bottom. I may have ordered a size to big despite measuring my belly because it seems so loose in the back at the top and around my hips so o have to make it really tight around my belly which is u comfortable. It says to contact seller for size exchanges in your order section but I'm not able to find any contact information. Other than leave a review. I was so desperate for this band to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Coigley

customer_reviews.title: Must have pregnancy wear
customer_reviews.text: If you’re pregnant you need this! Especially in the later months, moving around is not as easy as it once was. I tend to wear it over clothing as it’s easier to get on and off but I’ve also worn it under clothing when going out of the house and it sits very smoothly under clothes. I use the tummy and back support together and I can tell the difference on days when I do and don’t wear it. Not comfortable to sit in for longer periods of time, but frankly you don’t need it when lounging around. Perfect for soon to be mamas!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and has saved me!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous at first to buy this maternity belt. This is my second pregnancy and I didn’t need one with my first. But after having some pelvic pain I decided try one. I wasn’t sure if this was the right choice for me due to how large it looks but now that I have worn it it is very comfortable and has helped out a ton. I am 5’6, 152 pounds and I bought the medium and it fits just fine. I was skeptical at first since others said they couldn’t put it on by themselves but I find it rather easy to put on and adjust if I need too. Yep thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: randy butternubs

customer_reviews.title: Does as I'd Hoped
customer_reviews.text: I have I used it three times since it arrived last week. I still have to look at the pictures to put it on right, but it really does help. I have an umbilical hernia and diastasis recti, and the support/ lift under my bump helps relieve the pressure/ discomfort in my upper abdomen. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Grimstad

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal
customer_reviews.text: Wife..."P.T told me to get one of these for abdominal and back support. This has too many pieces and that frustrates me. I'm actually looking at another one now. This is out of my return window so now I'm stuck with it. Didn't help me as much as I thought it would as far as support.
customer_reviews.author: mntsitalons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing extra support for every day use! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this belt because my OBGYN reccomended me to do so. I am 5'8 and weigh 138 lbs an carry my baby weight completely in my belly! Which in return has caused alot of strain on my sides and stomach. After purchasing the belt it came in very fast, and has made a tremendous difference in my pregnancy. It has helped relieve pain and the strain of my huge baby bump! It has also made every day activitys easier to with the extra help from the support belt! I'm very pleased with this belt and very happy that I ordered it! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Scottie M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t support me at all
customer_reviews.text: This does absolutely nothing for me. I carry low and really could use support but this belt does nothing. I can adjust it and make it as tight as possible but there’s no support at all. I am small and ordered a size small but at 8 months pregnant, this should do SOMETHING. Wish I’d returned it sooner but I waited a couple months to see if it would work later on in pregnancy. Unfortunately, it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Starrynight365

customer_reviews.title: Did help some.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to wear while I'm on my feet all day at work. I was laid off due to Covid, so fortunately, didn't even really have to use this much. I noticed when I did wear it, it was a bit hot & bulky feeling. But, did relieve some pelvic pressure & also helped the constant Braxton Hicks I get when I'm on my feet for too long. I'm wondering if I can use this after birth to help with postpartum belly?
customer_reviews.author: House Of Deebs

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: This band is ok. I'll probably get something different my bump is lower and i needed something to "hold it up in a way" and this one just doesnt do it its comfortable though and does help mg back out but the abdominal front band part is a little lousy the back support is great though
customer_reviews.author: Barry F

customer_reviews.title: Back saver!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this to bed almost every night around 6 1/2 months into my pregnancy. I wore it over my clothes though as I found the material itchy and uncomfortable and it was a bit to bulky to wear discreetly under my clothes. Towards the end of my pregnancy I was wearing it more and more as it offered much need support that relieved pressure from my lower back even if it wasn't the most attractive attire. I have since had my son and now a close friend that is due next month has been borrowing this brace for the last few months as her job is a physical one (mine is not) and she loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: NSM

customer_reviews.title: Best pregnancy purchase so far!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to buy this, but I am so glad I pulled the trigger. I seem to be carrying much lower this pregnancy, and also clean houses for a living so I needed the extra support. This belly band made a world of difference, literally within minutes of putting it on! I am 5’0 so I was worried it would be too long, but it fits great. I would not recommend wearing this if you sit for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be very supportive. I'm a larger sizes gal at 33 weeks pregnant and have had an increase in lower back pains this time around. My OB suggested a support belt, and this is doing the trick so far. The only upsetting thing for me is I have only worn this twice, and one of the metal ribs in the back piece that helps keep it's shape has poked through the fabric like the metal piece of a push up bra would.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Kocos

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This support was a lifesaver! It really provided great support and was easy to get on/off once you get the hang of it. I would recommend wearing a tank top or camisole under this as that definitely made it more comfortable on the skin, as it was a little scratchy right around where the velcro pieces are for that top band attach to the main support. But again, can't recommend this highly enough, especially for the price, I tried a Belly Bandit and was disappointed. This one was truly great for 2nd & 3rd trimesters.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome belly band!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently 31 weeks pregnant with my first, and was starting to get some back pain, and just feeling uncomfortable due to the extra weight of baby. I decided to purchase this belly band based on all the good reviews! I’ve been wearing it for a couple of days now, and find it very comfortable and supportive. I still have a bit of back pain, so I’m not sure if I could tighten it up a bit to help that, but it definitely lifts my belly so it doesn’t feel so heavy. For reference, I am 5’4”, 130 lbs. pre-pregnancy (currently 150), and ordered a medium. Definitely have plenty of room for the rest of my pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: ... have been wearing this for 2 days now and hate it! It is difficult to put it on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this for 2 days now and hate it! It is difficult to put it on because it is 3 pieces and typically has to be adjusted. It must be taken on and off every time you go to the bathroom if you have maternity pants with the high panel and with all pregnant momma's you are in the bathroom a lot. Try doing this when you are in a store with a toddler! At work, I am up and down all day and every time I stand, I have to pull it down, every time I sit, it rides up and I feel as though I am suffocating the baby. Most likely will be returning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Maternity Belt
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent maternity belt. It is very supportive and comfortable. It's very adjustable to fit throughout your entire pregnancy. It supports your back and stomach while helping to relieve stress and pressure. It can be worn either over or under your clothes. It's very undetectable under your clothes and doesn't look bad over either. I wore it at work and while relaxing at home because it was just that comfortable. A must have for any expecting Mama.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Deck

customer_reviews.title: Immediate pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: This belt made a huge difference with reducing my back pain when I was pregnant. I had reached a point where I couldn’t be on my feet for very long - typically more than 20 minutes left me feeling all the pain and discomfort. But this belt changed that within just a few days of wearing it. When I was 35 weeks I was able to walk around an outdoor market for over 3 hours with friends. This belt was the only thing I added to my routine and was so happy I did!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye pain!
customer_reviews.text: My body is hypersensitive and I really usually can’t stand tight things on my belly area, but holy crap does this thing help with my baby bump! I wear it anytime I go for walks or am running errands and it helps my back and hip pain sooo much. Very grateful to have found this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Roecker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to anyone pregnant !
customer_reviews.text: I’m 28 weeks pregnant and 4’8” as many of you can imagine my short stature is causing horrible pain and pressure to my pelvis and back. This bellyband has allowed me to move around and actually clean my house in a timely manner and it relieves all the pressure/pain I receive from round ligament pain. I even fell asleep in it on accident. Highly recommend to anybody that’s pregnant. Also I did ordered a size slightly larger than what I am because I do have a little way to go so I’m sure I’ll grow into it even more but even how it is now it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Wray

customer_reviews.title: Very Supportive! Quickly Relieved Lower Back Pain!
customer_reviews.text: I am carrying my son low and my lower back was constantly aching. I was also having lots of round ligament pain and I have a 30lb 20m old that likes to be held. Doctor recommended a maternity belt. I was a little skeptical about this belt because it seemed like there was a lot too it and it would be bulky and uncomfortable. I wear it when I’m going to be walking around a lot and on the weekends when my daughter needs a lot of attention, it quickly relieved my lower back pain and is very supportive. I’m glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Aggiebeck

product_meta.title: NEOtech Care Maternity Belt - Pregnancy Support - Waist/Back/Abdomen Band, Belly Brace (Beige, Size M)
feature_bullets: CHOOSING THE RIGHT SIZE: See 2nd product picture for HOW TO MEASURE then REFER TO SIZE CHART in product description below. Please measure from around your lower back to under your belly (slightly above the pubic area). Do NOT choose according to your maternity pants(trousers) size.
FULLY ADJUSTABLE to accommodate abdominal growth throughout pregnancy! NEW reinforced hooks and loops fabric fasteners!

BREATHABLE fabric constructed of a multi-layered laminate with an ELASTIC lining. This product is designed for walking or standing position, when sitting we recommend to detach the hooks and loops fabric.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
